name: well-eye
headline: Well Well Well, Look What Eye Have Here!
article: A monstrous eye has been found living at the bottom of our local well. Our on-the-scene reporter described peering into the well akin to "Delving into the abyss itself... Where the true master of our world lies... sorry, what were we talking about?"

outcomes.customDescription: Your townsfolk start having the strangest dreams...

name: time-being
headline: Tributes to the Time Being
article: A local cult has started making offerings to a mysterious creature in exchange for future sight. "We have a busy schedule ahead, so let's just leave this for the Time Being" chant the cultists.

outcomes.customDescription: Your townsfolk are fearful of this 'Time Being'

name: beetles
headline: Hello Beetles, Goodbye Beetles
article: Giant, monstrous beetles are migrating from the strawberry fields, terrorising the town this morning with loud, melodic buzzing from the rooftops. The town etymologist had hoped they would have moved along yesterday. The blackbird population is reportedly under attack from these creatures. Local blacksmith, Maxwell, claims he has just the right tool for the situation...

outcomes.customDescription: We don't know how much longer we can let it be...

name: feeding-day
headline: Feeding Day is Upon Us!
article: As it does every year, town prepares for its annual feeding day, when townsfolk come together to celebrate the sating of the beast. As is tradition, each home leaves a fresh ham upon their doorstep tomorrow night. Residents are being urged to purchase their hams quickly to avoid a long and agonising death for them and their loved ones this holiday season.

outcomes.customDescription: The beast will be fed for another year...

name: humming-lights
headline: Mysterious Lights won't Stop Humming
article: The strange dancing lights off the east side of town have started singing a little tune! Some claim it's cheerful, others ominous. Local residents have reported asking, "Oh God, oh God why won't they stop? Please, someone, make them stop."

outcomes.customDescription: The purpose of these lights are still to be determined

name: bandit-raid
headline: Bandit Raid Takes its Toll
article: Two Adventurers (and 13 villagers) have been struck down protecting our town from a clan of nearby marauders. They didn't even try to steal anything, they're just jerks.

name: stars
headline: Up to the Stars
article: Three extra stars have been discovered last night in the southern sky. They definitely weren't there before, and local cosmic diviners warn against looking at them for too long in case you start seeing things that DEFINITELY AREN'T THERE

outcomes.customDescription: Just don't look up and you'll be fine...

name: marching-bandits
headline: The Marching Bandits Strike!
article: After receiving reports of obnoxious sounds off in the distance drawing ever-closer, the odd group of ruffians known to terrorise their victims with terrible music has finally made it here, and made-off with a king's ransom in loot.

name: santa
headline: Ho Ho Horror!
article: An evil wizard dressed all in red with a sleigh and reindeer blazed through town, scaring residents and adventurers alike. The sound of his haunting laugh caused a few of our resident elves to flee in terror at the sound of their former master.

outcomes.customDescription: We're all getting coal this year...

name: mimic-swords
headline: These Mimics are Sharp!
article: Local adventurer returns gloriously from defeating a cave of mimics, only for his sword to try and eat him before running off. The whereabouts of this sword are unknown, so keep an eye out for any household items you don't remember buying!

name: gargoyles
headline: Gargoyles
article: Pest control has been called in, as a new pest has infested our town. Gargoyles have taken residence atop our watchtowers where Arcanists often go to study. The gargoyles were reported silent and unremorseful about their actions, remaining stone-faced in response to criticism.

name: crypto-miners
headline: Crypt-O Miners
article: A new alternative currency has taken hold of the town, and along with it, a series of grave robberies. Human bones, known to the community as 'Crypt-O' is a popular component for many Necromancers, and the sudden uptick in trade has given them an interest in our town...

name: bird-size
headline: Birds Incite Panic!
article: The town erupted into a panic today, when a towns-person noticed the size disparity between them and the birds flying overhead. "It's not something you really notice until it's pointed out, but WOW they could just pick one of us up with ease!"

name: rat-shortage
headline: Rat Shortage
article: Troubles grow for low-level adventures today as queues begin to back up all the way through the sewer due to a rat shortage. A traveling salesman conveniently is offering to sell the town "some rats he found."

outcomes.customDescription: The adventurers start griding for experience...

choices.name: Train up mice to be strong like rats

outcomes.customDescription: Oh no, the mice have grown too strong and escaped! We'll have to hunt them down...

name: sirens
headline: Tourist Death Trap
article: A flock of sirens has moved in a nearby cove by our shores, their alluring song bringing unaware tourists to their nest to be consumed. The performers have been sulking all week, claiming they've been upstaged. While deadly, the beaches have never been more lively...

outcomes.customDescription: The sirens gladly part with the loose gold they've found in the clothes of their prey...
Clearing their nest was a deadly affair, but the performers are glad they're now the centre of attention again.
It took 3 adventurers lives to wipe out their nest.

name: teleporting-boars
headline: The War on Boars
article: A string of reports have come in of a series of attacks by feral boars from seemingly nowhere. This reporter can only conclude these boars have the ability to teleport, and you should all protect yourself from the upcoming boar invasion.

name: alcohol-shortage
headline: Alcohol Shortage Causes Riots
article: Sobriety rates have never been higher as a recent hops shortage dries up our taverns. "There's too much blood in our alcohol stream!" groans a local adventurer who can't fight due to the collective hangover.

outcomes.customDescription: It took a while to figure out how to drain the flask into the pipes, but we've got liquor flowing again!
The adventurers breath a drunken sigh of relief...

choices.name: Order a Shipment from Far Away

outcomes.customDescription: It's going to take a while to get here, and local monsters have taken advantage of the situation...

name: bread-swords
headline: Bread-y for War!
article: The famous, illiterate adventuring group 'The Unreadables' was found in a tough spot going up against a water elemental, arming themselves to the teeth with baguettes and brioches after mistaking the local bakery for a blacksmith.

outcomes.customDescription: It thinks we're an easy and tasty target now...

name: murder-mystery
headline: A Not-So Mysterious Murder Mystery
article: Authorities still on the lookout for the culprits of the Dark Manor murders, after being fooled by the kitschy bed and breakfast spot into participating in an "immersive murder-mystery extravaganza" event late last week.

outcomes.customDescription: 2 Adventurers have been reported missing...

name: snakes
headline: Subdimension Spill Summons Slithering Species
article: A tear in reality has opened up, with snakes flooding out into the town square. Townsfolk are advised to avoid the affected area while we get these snakes off our material plane.

name: dragon-hoax-1
headline: Hoax Heralded on Scaled-Hoarders
article: Seasonal dragon attacks begin to ramp up once again, with many residents fireproofing their homes. As these measures are being taken, deniers decry the panic and moral crisis raised, demanding proof over the existence of dragon-fire before wasting another silver piece of taxpayer funding.

outcomes.customDescription: We'll be prepared for another year...
I'm sure it will be fine...

nextEvent.name: dragon-hoax-2
nextEvent.headline: "I definitely left my stove on, that's all this was"
nextEvent.article: The residence of outspoken dragon denier, Darlon Da'owren, burnt down this morning as a winged figure was spotted flying away. He stated that he had left the stove on, followed by "and even if it WAS a dragon, our environmental impact has nothing to do with their unusually southern migration - there's simply no evidence!"

name: markets-destroyed
headline: Collateral Catastrophe
article: The attempted arrest of a thief has resulted in an elaborate chase, lasting hours, knocking over every single cart and stall in the marketplace. Pots, rare spices, and cabbages alike were tossed up in the air one by one during this cinematic pursuit.

outcomes.customDescription: The offending Outrider (<sprite=1>) was banished from the town...

name: library-destroyed
headline: Best Left Unread
article: A local arcanist uncovered a dangerous book in the local library this morning, looking for a magical remedy for a blocked sink. Upon opening the book 'The Endless Drain', a vortex of immense, and seemingly endless appetite consumed the general vicinity whole. The damages incurred by the event included everything and the (still blocked) kitchen sink in spite of the arcanist's best efforts, commenting "perhaps this DIY thing isn't for me. Next time I'll be sure to call on Draino the Plumbing Wizard for all my unclogging needs!"

outcomes.customDescription: The Library was sucked into the vortex...
The Arcanist (<sprite=4>) was sucked into the vortex...

name: shrine-destroyed
headline: My Name is Ozymandias
article: A group of radical diviners have decided that the best way for their gods to be immortalised is by making their shrines symbolic and poignant ruins, the fast way...

outcomes.customDescription: The Shrine just has the feet now...
One of the Diviners (<sprite=3>) was poetically crushed under their own symbolism...

name: herbalist-destroyed
headline: Soil Eater
article: A herbalist was the centre of a sudden curse of rot this morning, draining all the life from the garden and surrounding fields. Luckily, the curse had not spread far before the source was identified and quarantined; a rare soul eater herb, which sucks the life out of any soil it grows in. Recent Guild Co. ordinances have dropped the restrictions of the growth of this plant, so who knows when the next slip-up may be?

name: frog
headline: Frog Fraud
article: A shape-changing monster disguised as a frog has been reported consuming an adventurer whole before escaping today. Witnesses report that the creature lured the adventurer in claiming to be royalty trapped in the body of a frog, and requiring a kiss to be freed from the curse. When close enough, the creature then extended its mouth and ate the poor adventurer sword and all.

outcomes.customDescription: Be on the lookout for any royal frogs...

name: behind-you
headline: Caution!
article:
If you're reading this, it's right behind you.

Just keep reading and don't look, and it'll go away eventually...

outcomes.customDescription: That's it, no sudden movements...

name: laughing-forest
headline: Laughter From the Forests
article: Local reporter is requesting whoever is going into the forests late at night to cackle please stop, or a least do it further away.

outcomes.customDescription: You hear them too, don't you?

name: dragon-libel
headline: Local Dragon Files Libel Complaint
article: A local guild official was accused of misrepresenting facts when they claimed that Zanthyloxynym, the Red Dragon of the Burning Vale's hoard was "...worth millions..." "This is a blatant attack on my character!" the dragon exclaimed, "It must be worth at least BILLIONS at this point!". The news seems to have encouraged a new influx of adventurers, eager try their luck with the dragon's hoard.

outcomes.customDescription: The dragon likes a challenge...

name: tooth-fairy
headline: The Tooth Hurts
article: A warning to any parents out there to urge children against putting loose teeth under pillows for the tooth fairies. While they seem whimsical and wondrous, they are in fact just the larval stage of the far more deadly 'bone fairy'. Hide your teeth! It's better to starve them before they get too strong.

outcomes.customDescription: We've already caught a few hiding under pillows...
